rComments: Lectures can be slow and there are a couple questions on the tests exclusively from lecture. Test is a lot easier than the text material and focuses mostly on lecture material. Don't need any bio background to understand.

easiest class ive taken since freshman year. psych students seemed to really struggle while bio students never showed up. I had encountered pretty much all of the concepts in far greater detail in real neuroscience classes. I liked prof but dont really think this class should be a neuro major elective, too basic after already taking bio125 and 126

you need to realize it is neuroSCIENCE. It is not Behavioral Psychology. but really not overly intensive in the bio, I've taken both Biol 125(Neuroscience) and this one. This is simplified so much to give psych majors a chance to study this without needing the knowledge from chem 1A,B,C/N, bio 20A, Chem 108A/L, and Biol 100/K. If you try itll be ok

This senior seminar Evolutionary Psychology was great at times and painfully dull at others, his lectures would cure an insomniac. Luckily he only lectured for the first half of the quarter and then we gave our 30 min presentations the rest of the quarter. This senior seminar was an easy A but the first half was just dull dull dull...

catalog says: "Principles of nervous system organization are discussed at each level". I don't understand the unhappiness about required "bio" for the class cause it was in lectures and really wasn't all that advanced. Anyway, you still need to apply yourself in this class. It's pretty tough but manageable. Also a plus is he enjoys the subject

I really wanted to like this class but his lectures were so disjointed that it was completely useless to go to class. The fact that he uses one of the old carousel slide projectors where you have to manually load in each slide is just a testament to how outdated his lecturing style is.  Completely out of touch with students, would not recommend.

My interest level in neurophysiology was very high until I realized the lectures have nothing to do with what I was reading. Then I got nervous, had to scramble and learn various bits of information that seemed to be relevant to the midterm and the final (there was a big paper in between, which was fine). He didn't rock my world, to say the least.

Going into the class, I was so excited to study neuroscience, but I quickly realized what a challenge it was going to be - not because of the material but because of his instruction. He assumes his students already know the basis of neurology, and then expands off of that, making it impossible to follow. Avoid unless your a neurology pro!

As someone interested more in neuro, I loved this class. Bruce knows the material well, and gives great feedback if you ask for it. His lectures are very structured but can be entertaining. Definitely keeps you on your toes with the bio/chem. Curves the tests, thankfully. TAs are a godsend in this class.

My gawd is he terrible. I'm a neuroscience major in my senior year and I found his class to be overly difficult (AVOID if you're a psych major, he expects a bio background). He also steals material not just from the biology course's neuroscience book but even his jokes are stolen! Terrible, disorganized, and unoriginal professor. AVOID!

I love Bruce! He loves teaching the subject and knows a whole lot about it. He's willing to help if something isn't clear and loves to be asked questions during lecture. This material is not easy, but if you show up to lecture and section, do the labs and problem sets you will pass this course. He curves the multiple choice tests!

Bridgeman definitely knows his stuff about cognitive psych. Lectures can be a little dry but sometimes he'll do cool/funny demos. Psychobio wasn't too bad, neuroscience was kinda hard, but there was a magnificent curve at the end of that class. Thought I might fail or get a D and got a B. Tough it out or try another UD cog class. Okay overall.

Do not take Bruce Bridgeman ! ever! he is the worst professor i have had at UCSC so far...he make behavioral neuroscience hell...and ruined my interest in the subject. it is a hard and unfair class. it was a waste of my time and hurt my GPA

PROS: Bruce is very excited about teaching.  He does everything he can to be interesting and engaging. CONS: He is extremely unclear, teaches from a completely different textbook, forgets topics that he has already discussed, puts terms on the test he didn't cover in class, asks somewhat random questions.  OVERALL: just ok, fun guy, bad class

Unless you love bio, don't take it.  I am an A student and I'm just hoping to pass this class. He is really into teaching but is to connect to the students in lecture.  I was lost from the first day.  Avoid it at all costs.  Don't let Donna talk you into taking it.

behavioral neuroscience is not a psych class. it should not even be listed as a psych class, it is a bio class. it is not psych, psych majors need not even sign up.  don't do it.  i thought i would like it, and i don't.  i have not learned anything about psychology all quarter, i doubt that you will either.

THIS IS NOT A PSYCHOLOGY CLASS!!!!! IF you are a psych. major do NOT take this class!! I looked him up on this site before signing up for the class, and because of a few people's comments I thought "well how bad can he be if some people love him?" Don't make the same mistake I did, trust me, if you are a psych major avoid this class at all costs.

Bruce is great, his lectures are always informative and interesting. I looked forward to them everytime. He refers to the text very often, it would be most beneficial to bring it with you to class. He also is very easy going and helpful. Definitely one of the best psych professors around, he made me fall in love with psychology :)

If you're not a stellar Bio student AVOID Bruce's class!  Though he is kind and funny, he assumes that all his students have a strong scientific foundation.  Without one you are screwed.  I am an "A" student and was lost from day one.  I ended up dropping (along with many others).  If you are a science type, you will love him.  Mind the drop dates.

Bridgeman rules! Psychobio was extremely boring until his 1/3 of the class came around, and then it was like, bam! Bridgeman is the quintessential scientist-if you have an appreciation for all things scientific, you will be utterly fascinated by his view of the world. Interesting and always engaging. Only the intellects will get his jokes.

This guy gets off on failing like 1/2 his class... he is a horrible teacher, his tests are hard.... he treats his students like they dont mean anything. I would advise against taking this if you're interested in psych... take something else, you're doomed

Great teacher. Lectures are a bit boring but you need to really listen. The information is great and Bridgeman is a genuinely nice guy. If you go to his office hours it really helps. Probably one of the smartest professors around. Great reccomendation.
this guy puts you to sleep instantly. if you read the chapters before the lectures, what he says actually clarifies. too bad everyone's too asleep to care.
this teacher was a very odd speaker, he didnt have any student skills, and was sort of cold toward the class.
Very boring very vague lectures.. Someone brought a cricket machine to class..

Boring, unclear lectures. Most of the important stuff he said had to be interpreted by my TA because it was so vague. Extremely easy test and very lenient grader - our curve was about 15%. Make sure you go to the TA-run review sessions!! If you do not, you will fail. The paper was very easy though.
bruce's lectures weren't too bad...but his midterm was a slap in the face.  be prepared.

Horrible! He is obviously very smart and likes cognitive psychology but he is not a very good teacher. He wrote the test the night before and it was atrocious!! The mean for the 250 person class was 58% highest score was a B (& their score was something like 84%) That says something about the test!!
horrible...absolutely horrrible
I like him, I think there is something very cute about him. His class is actually a lot more interesting than people give him credit for...or I'm just insane? Perhaps.
He knows his stuff and his lectures are clear.  He's a bit nervous in front of groups, but an excellent prof.
boring, but in a cute way, ya know?

psych 1 was set up with 3 sections, all taught by diff profs. the other 2 were good, but b was extremely unclear and his exam was tough (nearly everyone failed it). if youre going to have him, make sure you get a tutor to help you out.

HORRIBLE!!! One of the worst professors I've ever had. Gave one of the hardest midterms ever. Did not prepare students at all. DO NOT TAKE A CLASS HE IS TEACHING!!! Save your self the AGONY. He knows the material very well, he just can't teach.

The worst teacher I have had thus far. He was incredibly boring and I had the hardest time staying awake. I fell asleep during almost every lecture. He couldn't explain something if his life depended on it. Basically he suxs! But still take psych 1 because Faye Crosby is an awesome teacher!

so so boring and made an unfair midterm. i always fell asleep in class because of him and his lectures were pretty much useless for his own test and covered very little information. no where near as awesome as faye crosby
very boring, didn't keep me interested - too much information to comprehend without being interested, midterm was not at all what i expected
kind of bland, his third of the class wasn't as hard as the first third, but still went into way too much detail for an intro class.
Asked some questions on test that weren't in book or lecture, had the most difficult test of the 3 teachers for psychobio
